summary: This bill, HR 3068, amends the Arms Export Control Act to modify provisions related to AUKUS defense trade cooperation. It specifically alters Section 38 of the Act regarding export controls and modifies the policy regarding the Missile Technology Control Regime. Furthermore, the bill declares it is no longer the policy of the United States to deny exports of certain materials to NATO allies, major non-NATO allies, or the Five Eyes intelligence alliance members (Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United Kingdom, and the United States).
